subject: Re: [junit] performance testing
msgSnippet: ... The Ant task  gives you this information. I recommend using it to run your tests for this information. http://ant.apache.org Good luck. -- J.
messageBody:
Nathan Coast wrote:

> Hi,
>
> Is anyone doing performance testing with junit or a junit extension? I've
> looked at JUnitPerf and I don't think it has the functionality I need.
> I'd like
> to record the time taken to execute individual junit tests. The idea is
> that it
> should then be possible identify when code changes occurred that caused a
> significant drop in performance.

The Ant task <junitreport> gives you this information. I recommend using
it to run your tests for this information.

http://ant.apache.org

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
